column4: Hello, I got a quite big problem. I installed Ubuntu Hoary yesterday on my laptop. Dual-boot with winxp. (on same Harddrive). I created a partition, 4Gb with ubuntu on. And another, 1Gb as a swap. The rest of the harddrive is dedicated to winxp. (ntfs). I would like to remove ubuntu completley. When I enter the ubuntuinstallation, where you can edit partitions, it doesnt recognize any partitions at all. Just a single drive. Partition magic in win
Do you have WinXP installation disk? Use its partition tool, it will show ext3 and reiser partitions as "Unknown".
Remove the Ubuntu partitions, reboot, go to CD's recovery console and run command "fixmbr". It will then replace Grub with Windows' boot loader.
